734691f-b.title: North (Hudson) River - Piers 91, 92, and 93 - Manhattan.
734691f-b.text:
North(Hudson) River: showing Piers No. 91 and 92 under con-
struction. The photographer is viewing northward from a point at
Vest 51st Street, to show the deep excavation between that point
and 52nd Street. To the left is Pier No. 93.
Oct. 3, 1933
P. L. Serr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
734691f-b.folder: Piers 91, 92, and 93 - Manhattan., Hudson River, Manhattan, NY

710593f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 17th Street
710593f-a.text:
Eleventh Avenue, east side, from 17th to 18th Streets.
April 2, 1929.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

710592f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 17th Street
710592f-a.text:
11th Avenue, 17th Street, to 18th. (Before Reconstruction).
President Horough of Manhatter.

J 4, iRaiw

734692f-b.title: North (Hudson) River - Piers 91, 92, and 93 - Manhattan.
734692f-b.text:
North (Hudson) RiverI showing Piers No. 91 and 92 (under con-
struction and 93 (on the extreme right). IIn the foreground, the City
is building several new 100U foot structures to berth huge Trans-
Atlantic liners. The photographer is viewing northward from W. 51st
Street, to show the deep excavation necessitated by same. IIn the
background, across the river is the Jersey Shore and highlands.
Oct. 3, 1933.
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
734692f-b.folder: Piers 91, 92, and 93 - Manhattan., Hudson River, Manhattan, NY

734004f-b.title: East River - Pier 17 - Manhattan - South Street - [Unloading boats for Fulton fish market.]
734004f-b.text:
(1)  Pier 17 East River, east side of South Street. The view shows
fishing boats unloading for the Fulton Fish Market.
About 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at a later date, and at a slightly different angle.
Augst 20, 1925.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
734004f-b.folder: Pier 17 - Manhattan - South Street - [Unloading boats for Fulton fish market.], Manhattan, NY

734693f-a.title: North (Hudson) River - Piers 91, 92, and 93 - Manhattan.
734693f-a.text:
North (Hudson) River showing Piers No. 91 and 92 (under con-
struction) and 93 (right, covered in). These new structures will
be 1000 feet long, enabling the huge ocean liners to berth have
comfortably. The deep excavation necessitated by same is to the
left where the steel towers stand. In the background, across the
river, is the New Jersey Shore line. The photographer is viewing
westward from a point between West 51st and 52nd Streets.
Oct. 3, 1933
Views 1 and 2
N. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
734693f-a.folder: Piers 91, 92, and 93 - Manhattan., Hudson River, Manhattan, NY
